channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia's COVID-19 deaths rise to 71, WHO defends China's revised death toll

item.description: Just don't put it on speaker.
item.title: The switchboard: a more worldly and wider web

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Field 16 players a side, cut football department spend and get rid of VFL affiliate teams. These are Leigh Matthews' recommendations for the future of football.
item.title: Play it forward: How Lethal thinks footy should change post-virus

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW deputy premier John Barilaro is eyeing regional sport centres as an option to house interstate NRL players as the push continues to restart the season.
item.title: Barilaro looks to the regions to offer NRL a lifeline

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: ARLC chairman is keen to utilise COVID-19 tests recently developed by airline giant Emirates which can deliver results in 10 minutes.
item.title: V'landys eyes new rapid blood-testing for NRL players

item.dc:creator: Chloe Saltau
item.description: Former vice-captain Adam Gilchrist has forecast a dramatic scaling back of player salaries and the overall cricket economy amid a grim outlook for revenues as a result of the pandemic crisis.
item.title: Axe may fall on small army of support staff as CA looks for savings

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Booksellers and publishers on Sunday demanded the Prime Minister act on the problem at a time when stores have been forced to close.
item.title: Turnbull's publisher to refer copyright breaches to AFP

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic is having a devastating impact on local council jobs - particularly for casual workers.
item.title: Thousands of council workers stood down or terminated as virus hits

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: An 18-year-old, arrested in Melbourne's west for repeated breaches, told police he had COVID-19 and threatened to cough on them.
item.title: COVID-19 arrest: Teenager accused of threatening to cough on police

item.description: Nostalgia conquers all when Elton John, Paul McCartney, and Lady Gaga are the main event.
item.title: One World review: Superstars milk nostalgia

item.dc:creator: Tate Papworth
item.description: The family of the 15th Victorian to succumb to COVID-19 has issued a plea for people to take the threat of the virus seriously.
item.title: Family's plea after death of 'larger than life' grandfather

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 20, 2020

item.description: North Queensland coach Paul Green insists the club is committed to the NRL's plans to resume its season though he is yet to speak to his players about the possibility of shifting base.
item.title: Cowboys committed to NRL restart plan

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Melbourne midwife Jacqueline Vella is devastated after losing thousands of dollars on a cancelled family holiday, but she and many other grounded travellers have nowhere to turn after the peak travel industry body last month suspended its complaints handling panel for months.
item.title: 'Crying for days' as frustration with travel agents grows

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Test results will help determine which Ruby Princess crew members may be allowed to fly home and avoid the sea journey to the Philippines from Sydney.
item.title: 'The end is near': Ruby Princess crew wait for approval to fly home

item.dc:creator: Hannah Barry
item.description: After being the WA government's biggest headache for weeks, the virus-riddled Artania has finally departed Fremantle.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Artania crew to depart WA as Premier reveals minor changes to rules soon to come

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: The image from a glass plate negative was taken in 1900-1901 or thereabouts, not long before the road was bulldozed clean off the map with the march of gentrification.
item.title: Mystery surrounding woman on ghost street in Pyrmont

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Some will see the former PM's long-awaited memoir as sour grapes, but the book makes a broader point.
item.title: Turnbull memoir makes case for a moderate, tolerant Australia

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Ambulance Victoria says there's been a 30 per cent drop in triple zero calls, with about 200 a day suspected COVID-19 cases.
item.title: Triple-zero calls drop in Victoria, but paramedics brace for surge

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Some students have been told that they would need to download the ProctorU software in order to complete upcoming exams while meeting social distancing rules.
item.title: UQ students raise privacy concerns over third-party exam platform

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: A Cox Plate run at night is one proposal the MVRC will consider after chief executive Michael Browell conceded the 100th running of the race will go ahead without crowds.
item.title: Cox Plate under lights one option 'on the table'

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Australia's four highest-paid players will sacrifice $1 million between them under a pay deal set to be agreed between Rugby Australia and the players union.
item.title: Rugby poised to slash its player wage bill by 83 per cent

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Residents across Sydney are taking advantage of the lack of cars on the road and turning to cycling as an alternative form of exercise.
item.title: 'A ton of demand': Bike shops in recruitment mode as cyclists flock to the roads

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: With little fanfare, Australian television has undergone its biggest change in decades, taking a huge leap towards the abandonment of Australian content quotas.
item.title: Australian creators fear extension of 'emergency' TV content quotas

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: In a letter to the Planning Department last month, WaterNSW said the extension of South32's Dendrobium underground mine could also trigger rock fracturing and potential water losses.
item.title: WaterNSW warns of 'extreme' risks from expansion of catchment coal mine

item.dc:creator: Tate Papworth
item.description: Police have charged a woman following a seemingly racially motivated bashing in a busy CBD street.
item.title: Woman charged over alleged international student bashing

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: No church-going or lamb on the spit, but families still celebrated an Orthodox Easter like no other.
item.title: Families strive for cracking good time at a humbler Orthodox Easter

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The sweeping crackdown amid a coronavirus pandemic is based on charges of unlawful assembly stemming from huge protests in Hong Kong last year.
item.title: Payne condemns Hong Kong arrests of democracy advocates amid coronavirus

item.description: St Kilda speedster Bradley Hill is confident three weeks is enough for players to prepare for the restart of the AFL season.
item.title: Saints' Hill backs lead-in for AFL restart

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Malcolm Turnbull's memoir has yet to be released, but that hasn't stopped an outbreak of Liberal Party infighting over the weekend.
item.title: Liberal Party conservatives want 'immediate' expulsion of Turnbull

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has conceded the first days of term two could be confusing for some parents, with two hotlines set up for those seeking help.
item.title: Parents not expected to teach kids from home, as Queensland cases inch up

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: North Melbourne star Emma Kearney is in the mix to become the first player to win a clean sweep of the AFLPA's AFLW awards, which will be announced online on Monday.
item.title: Clean sweep on offer for Roos captain Emma Kearney

item.description: Governors eager to rescue their economies and feeling heat from President Donald Trump are moving to ease restrictions despite warnings from experts.
item.title: Encouraged by Trump, protesters pressure governors over lockdown

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has returned serve after copping criticism from NSW Origin coach Brad Fittler.
item.title: Queensland premier fires back at Fittler ahead of talks with NRL

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Rugby Australia will have to lodge audited accounts by the end of the month before World Rugby agrees to a bail-out... but even then, the portents remain bleak.
item.title: Clock ticking towards rugby's doomsday

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: The Prime Minister's office, accused of trying to undermine the publication of Malcolm Turnbull's new book, appears to have undermined itself.
item.title: Trying to jab Turnbull, PM's office pokes itself in the eye

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Police and immigration officers swooped on the yacht without two men on board knowing what was happening.
item.title: 'Caught by surprise': Tonne of ice seized on yacht off NSW coast

item.description: Supercars champion Scott McLaughlin is livid after crashing out of contention in the latest instalment of Indycar virtual racing on Sunday.
item.title: McLaughlin mad after Indycar virtual crash

item.description: More than 20,000 people have died in Spain from COVID-19, but the Australian cyclist couldn't help but take a drive.
item.title: 'Cracked': Rohan Dennis flouts Spanish lockdown laws

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: The champion New Zealand jockey is worried about the state of racing across the Tasman, which has been suspended indefinitely because of the coronavirus, and believes his future lies in Australia.
item.title: Bosson considers full-time Sydney return after being carnival leader

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The national cabinet will consider restarting elective surgeries and IVF treatment when it meets this week.
item.title: Elective surgeries, IVF treatment set to be restarted

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Anglicare Newmarch House is now the second biggest cluster of coronavirus cases in NSW after the Ruby Princess.
item.title: Second man dies at Sydney aged care home as cases at facility rise to 39

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald / The Age / Financial Review photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week, April 16, 2020

item.description: The public health system in Sao Paulo is approaching its limit with several city hospitals close to filling all their intensive care beds.
item.title: Brazil digging large-scale graves ahead of coronavirus peak

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Police are searching for the owner of oars found washed up on the banks of the Brisbane River on Sunday.
item.title: Up the creek without a paddle? The police want to speak to you

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: Highlights of the global music fundraising online 'concert' included the Rolling Stones, Taylor Swift, J-Lo and Paul McCartney.
item.title: Superstars sing it in for charity from their (very nice) homes

item.description: There is a whole lot more to teaching than the misconception of mere chalk and talk.
item.title: Online learning is missing one vital ingredient

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: Bennett may have one of the NRL's great poker faces, but Renouf insists the man who launched one of the great rugby league dynasties is actually a lot of fun.
item.title: Wayne Bennett was the life of Broncos' party: Brisbane legend Steve Renouf
